definitions: characterized by verbal attacks or strong controversial arguments in debates
examples: His polemical essay sparked heated debates nationwide
The article's polemical tone alienated moderate readers

definitions: made smooth and shiny by rubbing or chemical treatment
showing a high degree of refinement, skill, or professional finish
examples: The polished marble floor reflected the chandelier lights
She wore polished black shoes to the interview
His polished presentation impressed all the board members
The pianist gave a polished performance at Carnegie Hall

definitions: having or showing behavior that is respectful and considerate of others
examples: The polite waiter always addressed customers formally
It's polite to thank people for their help

definitions: showing good judgment in dealing with people; tactful and diplomatic
examples: It would be politic to apologize before the meeting
Her politic response avoided offending either party

definitions: relating to the government or public affairs of a country
motivated by a person's beliefs or actions concerning political parties
examples: The political system needs fundamental reform to function
Political parties debated the new healthcare legislation vigorously
His political appointment raised questions about his qualifications
The decision seemed more political than practical

definitions: made dirty or harmful to health by adding poisonous or unclean substances
examples: The polluted river killed all the fish downstream
Polluted air causes serious respiratory problems in children

definitions: having more than one wife or husband at the same time
examples: Some polygamous societies allow men multiple wives simultaneously
The polygamous relationship structure requires careful negotiation

definitions: knowing or using several languages fluently; having multilingual abilities
containing, composed of, or written in several different languages
examples: The polyglot translator spoke seven languages fluently
Our polyglot tour guide switched languages effortlessly
The polyglot dictionary included entries in five languages
This polyglot edition features parallel texts side by side

definitions: having the shape of a polygon with many straight sides and angles
examples: The polygonal building had twelve distinct exterior walls
Ancient fortresses often featured polygonal defensive towers

definitions: relating to or characterized by belief in or worship of multiple gods
examples: Ancient Greek culture was deeply polytheistic in nature
Polytheistic religions recognize many different divine beings

definitions: containing more than one double bond between carbon atoms in fatty acids
examples: Polyunsaturated fats are considered healthier than saturated fats
Fish oil contains beneficial polyunsaturated fatty acids

definitions: affectedly grand, solemn, or self-important in manner or speech
examples: His pompous speech bored everyone at the ceremony
The pompous professor loved hearing himself talk endlessly

definitions: thinking about something carefully and at length before deciding
examples: She sat pondering her next career move carefully
The pondering expression on his face showed deep thought

definitions: slow and clumsy because of great weight or bulk
dull, laborious, or excessively solemn in speech or writing
examples: The elephant's ponderous movements shook the ground beneath
The truck made ponderous progress up the steep hill
His ponderous writing style made the novel difficult
The committee's ponderous deliberations lasted for months

definitions: lacking sufficient money to live at a comfortable standard
of inferior quality or below an expected standard of performance
deserving pity or sympathy due to unfortunate circumstances
examples: The poor family struggled to pay their monthly rent
Poor neighborhoods often lack adequate public services
The restaurant served poor quality food at high prices
His poor performance led to his contract termination
The poor child had lost both parents in the accident
Poor thing, she looks absolutely exhausted today

definitions: relating to modern popular culture, especially music or art
characterized by or making a sudden sharp explosive sound
examples: The pop music festival attracted thousands of young fans
Her pop art paintings sold for millions at auction
The pop sound startled everyone in the quiet room
Champagne bottles made loud pop noises at midnight

definitions: full of energy, excitement, or activity; very appealing or successful
examples: The club was poppin with great music all night
That new restaurant downtown is really poppin lately

definitions: liked, admired, or enjoyed by many people or a particular group
intended for or suited to the understanding of ordinary people
examples: The popular restaurant always had long waiting lists
She became popular after winning the talent show
Popular science books make complex topics accessible to everyone
The museum offers popular lectures every Sunday afternoon

definitions: having people living in a particular area or place
examples: The densely populated city faced serious housing shortages
Sparsely populated regions often lack public transportation services

definitions: having a large population; densely populated with many people
examples: China remains the world's most populous country today
The populous metropolitan area stretched for miles

definitions: containing or depicting explicit sexual material intended to stimulate erotic feelings
examples: The court ruled the images were pornographic in nature
Pornographic websites require age verification for access

definitions: full of tiny holes that allow liquid or air to pass through
allowing things to pass through easily; not effective at preventing entry
examples: The porous rock absorbed water like a natural sponge
Porous materials make excellent filters for liquids
The country's porous borders allowed smugglers easy passage
Their porous defense let opponents score repeatedly

definitions: situated on or relating to the left side of a ship or aircraft
examples: The port engine failed during the transatlantic flight
Turn to port when you see the lighthouse

definitions: able to be easily carried or moved from place to place
examples: The portable computer weighs less than three pounds
Portable generators provide emergency power during outages

definitions: depicted or described in a particular way in art or literature
examples: The villain was portrayed as ruthless and cunning
The film portrayed life in Victorian England accurately

definitions: arranged in a particular position for artistic purposes or photography
presented or constituted as a challenge, threat, or question
examples: The posed photograph looked stiff and unnatural
The models held their posed positions for the artist
The storm posed significant risks to coastal communities
These findings posed serious questions about safety protocols

definitions: elegant, fashionable, and expensive; associated with the upper class
examples: They stayed at a posh hotel overlooking Central Park
Her posh accent revealed her privileged background immediately

definitions: relating to or determined by position or placement in space
examples: The team made several positional changes during halftime
Positional warfare dominated the Western Front battles

definitions: relating to the act of putting something in a particular place or arrangement
examples: The positioning statement defined the brand's market place
Careful positioning of cameras captured every angle

definitions: constructive, optimistic, or confident in attitude or effect
consisting of or characterized by the presence rather than absence
showing the presence of a particular substance or condition
examples: Her positive attitude helped the team overcome challenges
The meeting ended with positive feedback from everyone
The positive numbers appear on the right side
A positive charge attracts negative particles
The test came back positive for strep throat
We received positive confirmation of the booking

definitions: controlled by an evil spirit or strong emotion
having or owning something as a belonging or quality
examples: The possessed man spoke in strange voices
She worked like someone possessed to finish
He possessed remarkable skills in negotiation
The library possessed many rare manuscripts

definitions: relating to or denoting grammatical case expressing ownership or association
demanding someone's total attention and love; unwilling to share
examples: The possessive pronoun 'their' indicates ownership
Add an apostrophe to form the possessive case
Her possessive boyfriend checked her phone constantly
He became possessive about his research findings

definitions: able to be done or achieved; within the realm of possibility
that may be acceptable or suitable for a particular purpose
examples: It's possible to learn a new language at any age
Rain is possible later this afternoon
We interviewed all possible candidates for the position
She chose the best possible solution available

definitions: relating to the public service of mail collection and delivery
examples: The postal service delivers mail six days weekly
Postal workers sorted thousands of packages during holidays

definitions: relating to professional work undertaken after completing a doctoral degree
examples: She received a postdoctoral fellowship at Harvard University
The postdoctoral researcher published groundbreaking findings

definitions: displayed or published in a public place or online platform
assigned to a particular place or position for official duty
examples: The posted signs warned visitors about construction ahead
She posted photos from her vacation yesterday
The soldier was posted overseas for two years
Guards were posted at every entrance point

definitions: situated behind or at the rear of something anatomically
coming after in time or order; later than something
examples: The posterior portion of the brain controls vision
Posterior teeth are used for grinding food
The posterior analysis revealed flaws in the methodology
These events were posterior to the revolution

definitions: relating to study undertaken after completing a first university degree
examples: The postgraduate program requires two years of study
Postgraduate students conduct original research for their degrees

definitions: occurring, awarded, or appearing after the death of the originator
examples: The author's posthumous novel became an instant bestseller
He received a posthumous medal for his bravery

definitions: occurring in or relating to the time after menopause has occurred
examples: Postmenopausal women face increased risk of osteoporosis
The study focused on postmenopausal hormone therapy

definitions: relating to art, architecture, or literature that reacts against modern principles
examples: The postmodern building mixed historical and contemporary styles
Postmodern literature often questions objective truth itself

definitions: relating to or characteristic of postmodernism as an intellectual movement
examples: The postmodernist architect rejected traditional design principles completely
Postmodernist critics challenged the notion of universal truths

definitions: relating to an examination or analysis conducted after death or failure
examples: The postmortem examination revealed the cause of death
They conducted a postmortem analysis of the failed project

definitions: occurring in or relating to the period after childbirth
examples: Postnatal depression affects many new mothers worldwide
The clinic offers postnatal care for six weeks

definitions: occurring in or relating to the period following a surgical operation
examples: Postoperative pain management is crucial for patient recovery
The patient experienced postoperative complications requiring additional care

definitions: occurring in or relating to the period immediately after childbirth
examples: Postpartum bleeding is closely monitored by medical staff
She experienced severe postpartum depression after delivery

definitions: relating to or affecting the position of the body
examples: Regular postural exercises can prevent back pain effectively
The therapist corrected her postural alignment during treatment

definitions: occurring or existing in the period following a war
examples: The postwar economy experienced rapid growth and expansion
Postwar reconstruction efforts lasted for several decades

definitions: safe and suitable for drinking; fit for human consumption
examples: The village lacks access to potable water supplies
They installed filters to make river water potable

definitions: having great power, influence, or effect; very strong or effective
able to achieve an erection or reach orgasm; sexually capable
examples: The medicine contains potent ingredients requiring careful dosing
Her potent argument convinced even the strongest skeptics
The fertility drug helps men remain potent longer
Many cultures associate certain foods with potent qualities
